p: The flavonoids represent a group of vegetal pigments with extensive distribution in nature, being available in fruits, seeds, flowers, and barks [ 91, 92]. Their basic structure is the flavan nucleus, which consists of 15 carbon atoms arranged in 3 rings (C6-C3-C6) which are labeled as A, B, and C. Figure 1 presents the structure of the flavonoids and their numbering to distinguish the position of the carbons around the molecule [ 74].
